name: Captain Marvel Quiz | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What race does Mar-Vell belong to?
questions.explanation:
Kree.

	The Kree are eternally at war with their rivals, the Skrulls. Mar-Vell featured heavily in the Kree-Skrull war, which was ended due to the untapped potential of Rick Jones.

Genis-Vell.

	Genis-Vell would adopt a number of superheroic monikers, among them Photon and, like his father before him, Captain Marvel. Genis-Vell has battled insanity as well as villains.

False.

	Mar-Vell died on Titan, a moon. He was surrounded by his friends and his lover Elysius when he passed away. Mar-Vell died of cancer which he received when fighting the villain Nitro.

questions.text: Another version of Mar-Vell became the warden of a prison in the Negative Zone. What is it called?
questions.explanation:
Forty-Two.

	Robert Reynolds, the superhero known as The Sentry, asked Mar-Vell to become the warden of the superhero-populated prison. Mar-Vell accepts, staying in the Negative Zone.

questions.text: In which issue of "Marvel Super-Heroes" did Mar-Vell first appear?
questions.explanation:
Twelve.

	He debuted in issue twelve, but he was revamped in issue seventeen of his own magazine and given a new costume. He was created by Stan Lee and Gene Colan.

questions.text: Shortly after arriving on Earth, Mar-Vell took this alias.
questions.explanation:
Walter Lawson.

	Walter Lawson was a scientist working at Cape Canaveral in Florida. He died a timely death, allowing Mar-Vell to use his name.

Eon.

	Eon dubs Mar-Vell the Cosmic Guardian, enhancing his already-improved reflexes and granting him even more power!

questions.text: Mar-Vell was once bound to Rick Jones.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Mar-Vell became imprisoned in the Negative Zone and could only escape if he and Rick Jones exchanged places. For a total of three hours, Mar-Vell could live on Earth, but if he exceeded that time limit, he would strand Jones in the Negative Zone forever.

questions.text: Whom did Mar-Vell battle as his physical body lay dying?
questions.explanation:
Thanos.

	Thanos is a power-hungry tyrant who has threatened the entire universe on more than one occasion! An Eternal, he has a fascination with death.

questions.text: What superhero team has Mar-Vell been affiliated with?
questions.explanation:
Avengers.

	Mar-Vell was granted posthumous honorary membership in the Avengers after he died of cancer. He was briefly resurrected by the Grim Reaper to fight the Avengers, but soon overcame the Reaper's control.
